channel.title: 3D Hour Glass
channel.description: My first 3D model. I think the glass is kind of off, and the wood texture is a bit fake, but it's alright.

item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:6, topic:294370”]It’s NOT alright.

Don’t settle for shit like that.

Get/make better textures. Make the shape better. Etc.[/quote]srry mr. i will try hrdr.

item.title: 3D Hour Glass
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Even this is your first 3D model you should try harder,

You will find textures here: http://www.cgtextures.com/ and never post an 3D model with a texture like that again.

You should not have just a white background, make at least floor and a background(Yes this is an awful solution, but it is better that he did.)

Use good reference image for making the hourglass shape and try until you get it as the image.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D Hour Glass
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

When everyone posts “good start” or “nice!” he doesn’t learn shit.

He actually learns that by representing something basically, it’s great.

Therefore, he never improves. His models will never look real.

If you want to be good, and anyone can be, then you have to make it right. Making it right is not getting an alright start and then saying it’s done even though this, that, and the other don’t look right.

If he strives to make it perfect (same shape, realistic materials, a composition, believable), then he’ll be good. But if he sits back and listens to you fuckers who think any model is a good model, then he’ll just make “eh” things.

You guys aren’t babies anymore. You (hopefully) have the mental ability to recognize criticism and expand yourselves based on that.

Read full topic

I learned half of what I know from STH, so shut up he knows what hes talking about.

item.title: 3D Hour Glass
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

I think he was referring to the actual size of the place where the sand goes through. It’s quite large, and would be able to move a lot of sand at once hence 5 seconds at once. xD

Nice for your first model though, good job.

Read full topic
